text:
When I run ant, I get this:

/usr/bin/ant: line 49:  1857 Segmentation fault      $JAVACMD -classpath
$LOCALCLASSPATH -Dant.home=${ANT_HOME} $ANT_OPTS org.ap
ache.tools.ant.Main $@


Any idea why?
creator: brendan.reville@tenzing.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
Is this RedHat 7.1?

If so, I've just installed it on my home box, just to have Sun's JDK 1.3 to
cause segfaults and  Blackdown's to hang.  IBM's seems to work so far.
I see this as well. With ant 1.2 or 1.3 on SuSE 7.1
creator: drapp@whizbang.com

text:
I have been using ant 1.3 on Linux Mandrake 8.0 with no problem.  I had been
using Sun's JDK 1.3.0_2 and IBMs JDK 1.3-8.  But today I downloaded the brand
new Sun JDK 1.3.1 off their release area (non beta/non developer).  I see this
exact same error when I run ant, now.  Ant version is 1.3.  Everything else I
have tested running under JDK 1.3.1 works fine.

Here is the output when I remove the ant shell file from the loop and simply cut
and paste the resultant command on the command line:

[droy@loki src]$ java -Dant.home=/home/droy/bms/ant/bin/..
org.apache.tools.ant.Main -find
Searching for build.xml ...
Buildfile: /home/droy/bms/src/./build.xml
Segmentation fault
[droy@loki src]$
creator: droy@boostmyscore.com

text:
I'm the original submitter.  Turns out that my path pointed at the wrong java:
the Kaffe one.  (An upgrade of Mandrake appears to have done this).  I changed
my path to point at the Sun java, and the segmentation fault no longer appears.
creator: brendan.reville@tenzing.com

text:
An additional data point:

If I set JAVACMD=java -classic then everything works fine...
creator: drapp@whizbang.com

text:
I think this bug is related to JDK bug 4459978 on Sun's Developer Connection. 
It's a bug between the JVM and certain versions of Linux, that manifests itself
when running Ant apparently.  I never see the bug in any other context, but
there is probably nothing that can be changed in Ant to fix this.
creator: droy@boostmyscore.com

text: *** Bug 1956 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
The workaround mentioned in
http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4447270.html
works for me.

Anyway - this is not a bug in Ant.
